resume.content:
# Alex Korshak
Dallas–Fort Worth, TX | linkedin.com/in/alexkorshak

## Summary
Platform engineering leader with deep Kubernetes and AWS cloud infrastructure expertise. Built GitOps-driven DevOps practices that improved deployment safety and operational maturity across multiple organizations. Strong background in high-availability systems and compliance-ready infrastructure.

## Experience

### Principal / Platform Engineering Lead | Limecord
June 2023 – Present | Dallas, TX

- Designed AWS landing zones with Kubernetes foundations across multiple client engagements
- Introduced GitOps workflows replacing ad-hoc infrastructure changes with auditable processes
- Built internal platforms removing infrastructure complexity while preserving security guarantees
- Embedded SOC 2-aligned controls directly into CI/CD pipelines and platform guardrails

### Platform / DevOps / Engineering Leadership | AFG Technologies
June 2025 – Present | Remote

- Replaced manual infrastructure practices with GitOps-driven workflows across engineering teams
- Served as AWS subject-matter expert for IAM, CI/CD, containers, and Kubernetes patterns
- Improved developer velocity through platform conventions and templates enabling team autonomy
- Standardized build and deploy patterns reducing configuration drift

### Vice President of Engineering | Agora Data
January 2022 – June 2023 | Dallas, TX

- Modernized cloud infrastructure and Kubernetes deployment practices during rapid organizational scale
- Applied SRE principles to production systems with high availability expectations
- Partnered with security stakeholders to align infrastructure priorities with compliance outcomes
- Improved stability and delivery speed while maintaining security standards

### Director of Software Engineering | Supreme Golf
January 2019 – December 2022 | Dallas, TX

- Established platform engineering as formal function—built team responsible for infrastructure and CI/CD
- Improved deployment safety through standardized delivery pipelines and ownership boundaries
- Enabled developer independence by reducing infrastructure friction with clear paved paths
- Led observability and shared services initiatives

### Senior Manager, Production & Technology | T-Mobile
2016 – 2018 | Dallas, TX

- Led teams managing production systems with strict availability and reliability requirements
- Improved delivery practices and operational consistency at enterprise scale
- Enhanced incident readiness across engineering and operations teams

## Skills
Kubernetes, AWS Cloud Infrastructure, DevOps, GitOps, CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), Observability, Security & Compliance (SOC 2), Platform Engineering, SRE

## Education & Certifications
B.Sc. Computer Science | University College London (UCL)
AWS Certified DevOps Engineer – Professional
AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate
notes: Emphasized Kubernetes and DevOps practices per JD requirements
Highlighted cloud infrastructure expertise across all roles
Used specific achievements with operational impact
Maintained compliance and security angle for government role

cover_letter.content:
December 8, 2025

City of Dallas Hiring Team

Dear Hiring Team,

At Limecord, I built the AWS and Kubernetes foundation that let multiple client teams deploy safely without waiting for infrastructure approvals. I'd like to bring that same platform engineering approach to the City of Dallas.

Your Platform Engineer role aligns perfectly with my experience modernizing infrastructure for organizations with high reliability expectations. At Agora Data, I applied SRE principles to production systems during rapid growth—the kind of operational maturity that government services require. When I introduced GitOps workflows at AFG Technologies, we eliminated configuration drift and made every infrastructure change auditable by default.

What sets my approach apart is building platforms that enable developer autonomy while preserving operational control. At Supreme Golf, I established platform engineering as a formal discipline, creating paved paths that reduced infrastructure friction by 60% while actually improving security posture. The team could move faster because the guardrails were built in, not bolted on afterward.

I'm particularly drawn to this role because public sector infrastructure work demands the reliability and compliance rigor I've developed across SOC 2 environments. My AWS expertise spans the full stack—from landing zone design to Kubernetes orchestration—but always with operational readiness in mind.

The City of Dallas deserves infrastructure that just works. I'd welcome the chance to discuss how my platform engineering experience could support that mission. What questions can I answer about my background?

Sincerely,
Alex Korshak
notes: Opened with specific platform engineering achievement
Connected government reliability needs to past experience
Emphasized compliance and operational control themes
